creator: kent@nrlmry.navy.mil
text:

Perl 5.8.0 successfully installed.

rossby 153% !124
./configure --prefix=/www/users/webuser/apache_light

APR Version: 0.9.3
/www/users/webuser/src/httpd-2.0.45/srclib/apr/configure[2351]: syntax error at 
line 15 : `newline or ;' unexpected
srclib/apr configured properly

  setting CFLAGS to ""

  setting INCLUDES to ""

Subsequently running make produced:
Making all in srclib
make[1]: Entering directory `/www/users/webuser/src/httpd-2.0.45/srclib'

make[2]: Entering directory `/www/users/webuser/src/httpd-2.0.45/srclib/apr'

My Bourne shell doesn't have emulate, or posix.
creator: kent@nrlmry.navy.mil
kent@nrlmry.navy.mil
text:
John,

Below is a description of how I determined that sed could be the problem:

During the ./configure for apache, I receive the following error:

/d/COTS/HTTPD-2.0.45/src/httpd-2.0.45/srclib/apr/configure[2016]: syntax
error at line 15 : `newline or ;' unexpected

The error suggests line 2016 of the srclib/apr/configure file is producing
the problem.  Below is line 2016:

. $pldconf

I looked at this file ($pldconf is config.pld), but the syntax did not
appear correct to use in the bourne shell, so I scanned the configure file
further to determine how this file was created.  A few lines above line 2016
(in the srclib/apr/configure file), sed is called, and the output is
redirected to $pldconf.  Because I was familiar with problems with awk
between linux and irix, I guessed that sed was the problem.  I compiled
gnu's sed on stratus and added the path to front of the $PATH variable.  The
configure and compilation completed successfully after the modifications.

Let me know if you need the sed code, and I can tar up the code I compiled
on stratus.

Dan
Can you attach the srclib/apr/config.pld file that is produced with the native sed?
creator: joe@manyfish.co.uk

text: This also fails on some SCO platforms it seems - bug 8570.
creator: joe@manyfish.co.uk

text: *** Bug 20634 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: jorton@redhat.com
jorton@redhat.com
text: *** Bug 23813 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
This has been fixed for the next 2.0 release, thanks for the reports.  In the
meantime, the workaround is to use GNU sed, as mentioned above.
